JobFullDesc: The Intellectual Property (IP) team is a group of experienced and dedicated legal professionals who provide strategic legal advice and counsel to clear IP risks for Uber's business and protect Uber's technologies and brands. The scope of intellectual property issues that we address includes trademark protection, trademark disputes, domains, online brand protection, patent protection, patent disputes, open source software, and IP transactions.About the RoleAs a member of the Uber IP team, you will work on a broad spectrum of intellectual property and technology matters. You'll work closely with clients to and other attorneys to deliver IP services that drive Uber's business forward. Example responsibilities include:Help develop Uber’s patent portfolio, including managing and working closely with outside patent counsel.Work with engineering and product teams to identify and harvest inventions in various technology areas.Counsel engineering and product teams on various IP and technology issues.Support IP aspects of M&A, litigation, pre-litigation IP disputes, employment, compliance, and open source activities.Assist in the development of analytics tools and models to inform Uber’s patent portfolio strategy, evaluate patent assets, and identify prior art.Negotiate, draft, and review agreements involving technology and intellectual property matters, including patent transfer/license agreements and other complex IP transactions.Educate and train Uber teams on IP subjects.Support and represent Uber in external IP engagements.Basic QualificationsMinimum five (5+) years experience in law firm or in-house setting practicing as an attorney working on patent-related matters.J.D. and license to practice law in at least one statePreferred QualificationsLegal experience in one or more relevant intellectual practice areas, such as patent prosecution, IP transactions and licensing, open source, patent litigation and pre-litigation IP disputes, trade secrets, copyrights, and trademarks. Broad patent prosecution experience; patent licensing or patent litigation experience a major plus.Proven aptitude for working across the full spectrum of intellectual property and technology matters.Inquisitiveness, along with the ability to spot issues, get to the heart of a matter, and articulate plans to address.Excellent business judgment, communication, and interpersonal skills.Passion for customer service and helping clients achieve their objectives.Collaborative approach with both business and legal groups, with strong ability to build relationships, gain credibility, and partner with others.Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment and take ownership of projects from inception to completion.Background in computer science, computer engineering, physics, electrical engineering, or other relevant technical fields preferred. Coding and data science ability and interest in analytics a major plus.Patent Attorney registered with the USPTO.Enthusiastic about Uber!
